Type REG /? at the Windows command prompt for further help with reg.exe commands. The program is located in the C:\​Windows\​System32\​ directory, but it can be run from any directory in the Windows command prompt.

NOTE: Be careful when saving and loading registry information, since corruption of the Windows registry can cause applications or the whole system to malfunction. The file setupreg.hiv included on Windows installation discs should not be edited manually, since it is used by the Windows installer.
